content: @Michel Rutten Michel, do you look after Simplifier also, or do you know how I can reach the Simplifier team? I'm trying to use Simplifier for one of our projects but getting a error when uploading an extension "Cannot process the request". Many thanks, Jonny
Hi Jonny Rylands, you can send an Email to simplifier@furore.com. You can attach the XML/JSON of the extension that you are trying to upload aswell, that would help
Hi Ardon, have sent those extensions through. Though unfortunately now getting the same error when uploading some standard profiles :-(

Hi jonny, I haven't seen a email yet but based on the project CareConnect I think I can see what the issue is. It turns out Simplifier is not able to process recourses with the profile's URL longer than 64 characters. We are working on it, short term solution will be to shorten the URL
Could i ask if you have a rough ETA on when it will be fixed? Many thanks.
Hi @Ardon Toonstra I've noticed it appears to only take URLs of 62 characters - possibly because it's saving the enclosing double quotes in the DB field?

Another question - sorry for spamming you - I'm trying to get a name to appear in the treeview where I've added an extension to a profile
e.g. https://www.simplifier.net/CareConnectConvergen/CareConnect-Problem-Condition-1
The first two child nodes are extensions but don't have a name against them.
Could you tell me which field I should be populating?
Many thanks,
Jonny
@Jonny Rylands It should just show the name property of the extension element, which you have populated. I'll try and find out what's wrong, and how to fix it.
Hi Jonny. I fixed the bug, it should be fixed with the next release of Simplifier. Thanks for reporting!
Excellent thanks - do you know when the next release is due?
